quote: Wise? No, I simply learned to think.
author: Christopher Paolini,  Eldest

quote: We are wiser than we know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The wise are not wise because they make no mistakes. They are wise because they correct their mistakes as soon as they recognize them.
author: Orson Scott Card,  Xenocide

quote: Wisest is she who knows she does not know.
author: Jostein Gaarder,  Sophie's World

quote: It is one thing to be clever and another to be wise.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

quote: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

quote: It is easier to be wise for others than for ourselves.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quote: The next best thing to being wise oneself is to live in a circle of those who are.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides,  The Bacchae

quote: Be wiser than other people if you can; but do not tell them so.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
author: Baltasar Gracián,  The Art of Worldly Wisdom

quote: Be happy. It's one way of being wise
author: Colette

quote: The wisest are the most annoyed at the loss of time.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: It is never too late to be wise.
author: Daniel Defoe,  Robinson Crusoe

quote: I would much rather be considered wise than smart. But, I still think it is wise to get an education.
author: Destiny Booze

quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare,  As You Like It

quote: A wise person is silent and rarely wants to show his wisdom. A fool is always vocal and uses every opportunity to show his foolishness.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: No man was ever wise by chance
author: Seneca

quote: We think a wise person is someone who solves problems. Truth is, a wise person is someone who avoids problems.
author: Prem Rawat

quote: A wise person does at once, what a fool does at last. Both do the same thing; only at different times.
author: John Emerich Edward Dalberg-Acton

quote: There are essentially two things that will make you wise -- the books you read and the people you meet.
author: Jack Canfield

quote: Wisdom is having things right in your lifeand knowing why.
author: William Stafford

quote: While wisdom dictates the need for education, education does not necessarily make one wise.
author: Ben Carson,  One Nation: What We Can All Do to Save America's Future

quote: When you come to see you are not as wise today as you thought you were yesterday, you are wiser today.
author: Anthony de Mello,  One Minute Wisdom

quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
author: Francis Bacon,  The Essays

quote: Wisdom is the oneness of mind that guides and permeated all things.
author: Heraclitus,  Fragments

quote: Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before.
author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Cat's Cradle

quote: A wise man first thinks and then speaks and a fool speaks first and then thinks.
author: Hazrat Ali ibn Abu-Talib

quote: A wise master teaches.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: A person is wise if he listens to millions of advice and doesn't implement any of it.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

quote: Misfortunes make us wise
author: Mary Norton,  The Borrowers Afield

quote: Learned we may be with another man's learning: we can only be wise with wisdom of our own.
author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays

quote: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Of all knowledge, the wise and good seek mostly to know themselves.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
author: Gautama Buddha,  The Dhammapada: The Sayings of the Buddha

quote: Angry people are not always wise.
author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice

quote: Before, you are wise; after, you are wise. In between you are otherwise
author: David Zindell,  The Broken God

quote: Wisdom ain't a virtue I ever aspired to.
author: Moira Young,  Blood Red Road

quote: Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom.
author: Elizabeth Gaskell,  Wives and Daughters

quote: Being a senior doesn't automatically make one wise but the wise & foolish alike have things to teach us.
author: Allan Lokos,  Pocket Peace: Effective Practices for Enlightened Living

quote: One way to define wisdom is the ability to see, into the future, the consequences of your choices in the present. That ability can give you a completely different perspective on what the future might look like.
author: Andy Andrews,  The Noticer: Sometimes, All a Person Needs Is a Little Perspective

quote: A wise man always has something to say, whereas a fool always needs to say something.
author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S

quote: The intelligent have plans; the wise have principles.
author: Raheel Farooq

quote: Wise men profit more by fools than fools by wise men.
author: Marcus Porcius Cato

quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Socrates

quote: A fool's paradise is a wise man's hell.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The greatest wisdom consists in knowing one's own follies.
author: Madeleine De Souvre Sable

quote: An intelligent person looks for problems to solve. The wise person looks for solutions.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Wisdom is worth more than gold.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita
